attributes.action: Reduce or remove the Severn Bridge tolls
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The River Severn Bridge tolls are now the highest in the UK. Why is it that this major road link between England and Wales is so expensive compared to other bridge tolls? Living in Wales has already become very expensive since 1997 due to the introduction of the Welsh Assembly, higher fuel costs, poor roads and virtually no public transport. 
The Monmouthshire council tax is now more than three times greater than it was in 1997.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Reduce or remove the Severn Bridge tolls."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page12829.asp

Prime Minister's Office
